title: 1992–93 National Division One
text:
The 1992–93 English Premiership, (known as the <a href="Courage%20Brewery">Courage</a> League for sponsorship reasons) was the sixth season of <a href="English%20Premiership%20%28rugby%20union%29">top flight</a> <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a> in England. Each team played each other once. 
<a href="Bath%20Rugby">Bath</a> were the champions, beating <a href="Wasps%20RFC">Wasps</a> on points difference. Due to a restructuring which reduced the league from thirteen to ten teams, four clubs were relegated; <a href="London%20Scottish%20F.C.">London Scottish</a>, <a href="Saracens%20F.C.">Saracens</a>, <a href="West%20Hartlepool%20RFC">West Hartlepool</a> and <a href="Rugby%20Lions">Rugby Lions</a>.
Results.
The home team is listed in the left column
